author: Staff Reporter
text:
A.G. Perarivalan, one of the life convicts in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case, said that he was satisfied with the State government’s move to seek the Centre’s view on the release of the seven convicts in the case, his advocate Durai Arun said.

He requested the State to further invoke Article 161 of the Constitution to release all seven persons, he said. “As per section 435 of CrPC, the State should consult the Centre on its decision to release us,” he said. – Staff Reporter
title: Perarivalan wants govt. to invoke Article 161
